description: Microsoft Translator APIs can be seamlessly integrated into your applications, websites, tools, or other solutions to provide multi-language user experiences. Leveraging industry standards, it can be used on any hardware platform and with any operating system to perform language translation and other language-related operations such as text language detection or text to speech.
steps: Sign up for a Microsoft Azure account at http://azure.com
After you have an account go to http://portal.azure.com
Select AI + Cognitive Services from the list of services.
Select Translator Text API. You may need to click `See all` or search to see it.
Fill out the rest of the form, and select the Create button.
You are now subscribed to Microsoft Translator Text API.
Go to All Resources and select the Microsoft Translator API you subscribed to.
Go to the Keys option and copy your subscription key to access the service.

blocks.name: getTranslate
blocks.description: Translates a text string from one language to another.If you previously used AddTranslation or AddTranslationArray to enter a translation with a rating of 5 or higher for the same source sentence, Translate returns only the top choice that is available to your system. The `same source sentence` means the exact same (100% matching), except for capitalization, white space, tag values, and punctuation at the end of a sentence. If no rating is stored with a rating of 5 or above then the returned result will be the automatic translation by Microsoft Translator.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: text
args.info: A string representing the text to translate. The size of the text must not exceed 10000 characters.

args.name: to
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text into.

args.name: from
args.info: A string representing the language code of the translation text. For example, `en` for English.

args.name: category
args.info: A string containing the category (domain) of the translation. Defaults to `general`.

blocks.name: getLanguagesForTranslate
blocks.description: Obtain a list of language codes representing languages that are supported by the Translation Service.  Translate and TranslateArray can translate between any two of these languages.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

blocks.name: getLanguagesForSpeak
blocks.description: Retrieves the languages available for speech synthesis.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

blocks.name: getSpeak
blocks.description: Returns a wave or mp3 stream of the passed-in text being spoken in the desired language.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: text
args.info: A string containing a sentence or sentences of the specified language to be spoken for the wave stream. The size of the text to speak must not exceed 2000 characters.

args.name: language
args.info: A string representing the supported language code to speak the text in. The code must be present in the list of codes returned from the method  GetLanguagesForSpeak.

args.name: format
args.info: A string specifying the content-type ID. Currently,  audio/wav and audio/mp3 are available. The default value is audio/wav.

args.name: quality
args.info: MaxQuality and MinSize are available to specify the quality of the audio signals. With MaxQuality, you can get voices with the highest quality, and with MinSize, you can get the voices with the smallest size. Default is  MinSize.

args.name: voice
args.info: female and male are available to specify the desired gender of the voice. Default is female.

blocks.name: detectLanguage
blocks.description: Use the Detect method to identify the language of a selected piece of text.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: text
args.info: A string containing some text whose language is to be identified. The size of the text must not exceed 10000 characters.

blocks.name: addTranslation
blocks.description: Adds a translation to the translation memory.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: originalText
args.info: A string containing the text to translate from. The string has a maximum length of 1000 characters.

args.name: translatedText
args.info: A string containing translated text in the target language. The string has a maximum length of 2000 characters.

args.name: from
args.info: A string representing the language code of the translation text. en = english, de = german etc.

args.name: to
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text into.

args.name: rating
args.info: An integer representing the quality rating for this string. Value between -10 and 10. Defaults to 1.

args.name: category
args.info: A string containing the category (domain) of the translation. Defaults to `general`.

args.name: user
args.info: A string used to track the originator of the submission.

args.name: uri
args.info: A string containing the content location of this translation.

blocks.name: getBreakSentences
blocks.description: Breaks a piece of text into sentences and returns an array containing the lengths in each sentence

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: text
args.info: A string representing the text to split into sentences. The size of the text must not exceed 10000 characters.

args.name: language
args.info: A string representing the language code of input text.

blocks.name: addTranslateArray
blocks.description: Use this method to retrieve translations for multiple source texts.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: from
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text from. If left empty the response will include the result of language auto-detection.

args.name: category
args.info: A string containing the category (domain) of the translation. Defaults to general.

args.name: profanityAction
args.info: Specifies how profanities are handled as explained above. Accepted values of ProfanityAction are NoAction (default), Marked and Deleted.

args.name: state
args.info: User state to help correlate request and response. The same contents will be returned in the response.

args.name: uri
args.info: Filter results by this URI. Default: all.

args.name: user
args.info: Filter results by this user. Default: all.

args.name: texts

structure.name: text
structure.info: Texts for translation.All strings must be of the same language.

args.info: An array containing the texts for translation. All strings must be of the same language. The total of all texts to be translated must not exceed 10000 characters. The maximum number of array elements is 2000.

args.name: to
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text into.

blocks.name: getLanguageNames
blocks.description: Retrieves friendly names for the languages passed in as the parameter languageCodes, and localized using the passed locale language.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: locale
args.info: A string representing a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code to localize the language names or a ISO 639 lowercase culture code by itself.

args.name: languageCodes
args.info: This field includes a list representing the ISO 639-1 language codes to retrieve the friendly names for.

blocks.name: detectLanguageList
blocks.description: Use this method to identify the language of an list of string at once. Performs independent detection of each individual array element and returns a result for each row of the array.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: textList
args.info: The size of the text must not exceed 10000 characters.

blocks.name: addTranslationArray
blocks.description: Adds an array of translations to add translation memory. This is an array version of AddTranslation.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: from
args.info: A string containing the language code of the source language. Must be one of the languages returned by theGetLanguagesForTranslate method.

args.name: category
args.info: A string containing the category (domain) of the translation. Defaults to `general`.

args.name: user
args.info: A string used to track the originator of the submission.

args.name: uri
args.info: A string containing the content location of this translation.

args.name: to
args.info: A string containing the language code of the target language. Must be one of the languages returned by the GetLanguagesForTranslate method.

args.name: translations
args.info: An array of translations to add to translation memory.The size of each originalText and translatedText is limited to 1000 chars. The total of all the originalText(s) and translatedText(s) must not exceed 10000 characters. The maximum number of array elements is 100.

structure.name: originalText
structure.info: A string containing the text to translate from. The string has a maximum length of 1000 characters.

structure.name: translatedText
structure.info: A string containing translated text in the target language. The string has a maximum length of 2000 characters.

structure.name: rating
structure.info: An integer representing the quality rating for this string. Value between -10 and 10. Defaults to 1.

blocks.name: getTranslations
blocks.description: Retrieves an array of translations for a given language pair from the store and the MT engine. GetTranslations differs from Translate as it returns all available translations.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: text
args.info: A string representing the text to translate. The size of the text must not exceed 10000 characters.

args.name: to
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text into.

args.name: from
args.info: A string representing the language code of the translation text. For example, `en` for English.

args.name: category
args.info: A string containing the category (domain) of the translation. Defaults to `general`.

args.name: maxTranslations
args.info: An integer representing the maximum number of translations to return.

args.name: state
args.info: User state to help correlate request and response. The same contents will be returned in the response.

args.name: user
args.info: A string used to track the originator of the submission.

args.name: uri
args.info: A string containing the content location of this translation.

args.name: includeMultipleMTAlternatives
args.info: Boolean flag to determine whether more than one alternatives should be returned from the MT engine. Valid values are true and false (case-sensitive). Default is false and includes only 1 alternative.See more in readme.

blocks.name: getTranslationsArray
blocks.description: Use the GetTranslationsArray method to retrieve multiple translation candidates for multiple source texts.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: from
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text from. If left empty the response will include the result of language auto-detection.

args.name: category
args.info: A string containing the category (domain) of the translation. Defaults to general.

args.name: profanityAction
args.info: Specifies how profanities are handled as explained above. Accepted values of ProfanityAction are NoAction (default), Marked and Deleted.

args.name: state
args.info: User state to help correlate request and response. The same contents will be returned in the response.

args.name: uri
args.info: Filter results by this URI. Default: all.

args.name: user
args.info: Filter results by this user. Default: all.

args.name: IncludeMultipleMTAlternatives
args.info: Boolean flag to determine whether more than one alternatives should be returned from the MT engine. Valid values are true and false (case-sensitive). Default is false and includes only 1 alternative.See more in readme.

args.name: maxTranslations
args.info: An integer representing the maximum number of translations to return.

args.name: texts

structure.name: text
structure.info: Texts for translation.All strings must be of the same language.

args.info: An array containing the texts for translation. All strings must be of the same language. The total of all texts to be translated must not exceed 10000 characters. The maximum number of array elements is 2000.

args.name: to
args.info: A string representing the language code to translate the text into.
